Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Mark R Allman was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Commencing forthwith.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program only after 18 months of initial confinement has been served.

superMiscConds.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from prison funds at a rate to be determined by Dept. of Corrections and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not enter any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license or without his supervising agent's permission.

Defendant shall maintain a stable residence. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty. Nadya Perez-Reyes from the State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Peter J Cannon for State.  State moves to orally amend complaint to reflect the allegation that the defendant operated a motor vehicle while under the influence of an intoxicant.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State to file an amended complaint.  State requests cash bond.  $2,500 cash bond set.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 8:15 a.m.
